revised_title: Theoretical Analysis of Hot-Spot Reaction Under Transient Pressure Conditions
tldr: This article investigates the thermodynamic behavior of hot-spot reactions under transient pressure conditions. It presents a theoretical analysis of how pressure changes, both self-induced and externally applied, affect the reaction rate and explosion times in condensed explosives. The study aims to provide a general analytical basis for understanding the complex phenomenon of hot-spot reactions and their role in shock-wave initiation in solids.
